p: In addition, many of the most vulnerable individuals are infected earlier on, so that later cases are also less serious because they involve more robust individuals, according to Hunter. “In the longer term, the Wuhan virus should not be anywhere near as serious, because an endemic disease affects more young people who are by then the ‘non‐immunes’”, he said. That was indeed the case even for the great Spanish Influenza Pandemic 1918/19, which caused a much larger proportion of severe cases and deaths among younger people than most other flu outbreaks. “That was when Spanish flu was in its first flush, not after it had become endemic”, Hunter explained.
